result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrell J Steward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment- apply bail. The Court ordered restitution set at zero.
Obtain full time employment OR attend school full time OR combination of the two.
The Court grants expungement of this matter ONLY if defendant successfully completion of ALL probation conditions ordered by the court.
Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment. Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrell J Steward

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrell J Steward in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for for sentencing purposes.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrell J Steward in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA file not in court. Defense counsel informed the court that the defendant would like to enter a plea on this case. Case adjourned in branch 24. Case remains calendared for jury trial trial 10/19/15.

Defendant Tyrell J Steward in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requeseted a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrell J Steward in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyrell J Steward in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice by phone.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Dentice is out ill today.  Defense counsel advised the court that she is not in receipt of discovery and has not met with the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Tyrell J Steward not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is in custody on a pending felony.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrell J Steward in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is Public Defender eligible.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrell J Steward in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Entry made without court file.  Case heard off the record.  Case scheduled for Pretrial conference.  Defendant is very ill and needs to go to the hospital.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed. Defendant instructed to contact the Public Defender's Office with next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrell J Steward in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.24.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/15 @ 1:30 pm
